oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William Thomspon to his sister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written "near Shelbyville" following the Battle of Stones River by Confederate soldier William Thompson on 11 January 1863 to his sister, this letter discusses the condition of the Army of Tennessee saying "The Army is very much worsted by their late exposures and hard marches but rest is bringing them right again." Thompson discusses being ill and asks his sister to send him something to eat and some wine.
